results.doc_title: 2026 Yearly Plan - Consumer Mega-Alliance - New Ventures
results.meeting_purpose: 2026 Yearly Plan review for Consumer Mega-Alliance New Ventures division

decisions.what: Keep momentum on Factor Programs physical product and plan ahead of Q2 development relaunch
decisions.context: Factor Programs fell below the line for Q4 and Q1, needed reprioritization alignment

decisions.what: Add 1 incremental PA resource to New Ventures domain space for analytics
decisions.context: Lack of analytics resourcing was highlighted as risk for New Ventures

decisions.what: Move Loyalty on Pets Table by 1 quarter to Q3 to leverage New Loyalty program launch
decisions.context: Alignment needed on how Loyalty should work for New Ventures and connect to New Loyalty strategy launching Q2-Q3

decisions.what: Make App Launch for Pets Table contingent on results of Elysium and ABBA app launches
decisions.context: Decision based on both financial and performance KPIs from other app launches

decisions.what: Cross Selling for other brands outside of HelloFresh and Factor is below the line for 2026, to be revisited for 2027 planning
decisions.context: Deprioritized for 2026 yearly plan

action_items.task: Review Factor Tech prioritization list against MD squad backlog
action_items.timeline: Completed - incremental asks pulled into Ed squad prioritization

action_items.task: Come back with Analytics resourcing plans for New Ventures
Connect with Adam Park on personalized performance stack plan for Factor Form
action_items.timeline: Added for exploration in Q3 plan

action_items.task: Update Yearly Plan to move Loyalty on Pets Table to Q3
Update Yearly Plan to make Pets Table App Launch contingent on Elysium and ABBA results
Finalize 2026 HC budget review
action_items.timeline: Under review following recent org changes

key_points: New Ventures team includes Good Chop, The Pets Table, Factor Form, and Market Innovation
Funded fixed HC for New Ventures is 50 with management structure of 1 Director of Engineering (Daniel Arias) and 1 Director of Product (Nikita Gorshkov)
Teams settling into new squad structure during Q4
New Ventures have self-funded with exception of +2 from Growth to fund Market Innovation squad
Factor Form should better connect products to customer goals for personalized performance stack
Aligned strategy needed for Loyalty across New Ventures brands
Exploring modernized CX leveraging AI for customer support, sales funnel, and retention flow
blockers: Lack of analytics resourcing for New Ventures (resolved with 1 incremental PA resource)
Factor Programs fell below the line for Q4 and Q1 requiring reprioritization discussion
Final 2026 HC budget under review with Finance and Portfolio due to recent org changes
Outstanding analytics backlog requiring temporary capacity
follow_ups: Review results of Elysium and ABBA app launches before proceeding with Pets Table app
Revisit Cross Selling for brands outside HelloFresh and Factor in 2027 planning
Explore personalized performance stack for Factor Form in Q3
Leverage New Loyalty program when it launches in Q2-Q3
Continue conversations with markets for 2026 planning with Theresa Stolberg

entities.context: Responsible for Factor Programs and Factor Tech prioritization list

entities.context: Human-grade pet food for pet parents, includes loyalty program and app launch plans

entities.context: Factor sub-brand supporting customers on holistic wellness and health goals

entities.name: Market Innovation
entities.context: Squad bringing new experiences across markets, funded by +2 from Growth

entities.name: New Loyalty program
entities.context: Strategy set to launch in Q2-Q3 that Pets Table will leverage

entities.name: Elysium
entities.context: App launch whose results will inform Pets Table app launch decision

entities.name: ABBA
entities.context: App launch whose results will inform Pets Table app launch decision

entities.name: MD squad
entities.context: Squad with backlog reviewed against Factor Tech prioritization

entities.name: Ed squad
entities.context: Squad that incorporated Factor Tech incremental asks into prioritization

entities.context: Parent brand mentioned in context of cross-selling strategy

entities.name: Factor
entities.context: Brand mentioned in context of cross-selling strategy and parent to Factor Form

results.meeting_purpose: Review and finalize the 2026 Yearly Plan for Consumer Mega-Alliance Q1, addressing feedback from draft reviews and aligning on strategic priorities

decisions.what: Create AOV-focused squad in Q2 with dedicated KPI, self-funded
decisions.context: Question raised during draft reviews about whether to invest in AOV-focused squad. Focus in Q1 is rolling out personalized core journey with widgets before layering in upselling components

decisions.what: Reserve 20% of engineering IC capacity for legacy loyalty program maintenance while evolving new loyalty framework
decisions.context: Loyalty strategy across markets needed clarification. New vendor-based loyalty program to launch first in US

decisions.what: Pause Programs on Factor funnel for peak due to negative results
decisions.context: Factor Programs Transition Plan - will partner with Commercial and New Programs hire in NA to design better 'Active Experience' and 3rd-party partnerships in Q2

decisions.what: Decouple forecasting from personalization models with technical interfaces
decisions.context: Enable independent iteration. Once validated, assess org impact in Q1-Q2

decisions.what: Prioritize recipe bridge feature in Q4/Q1 for Project 5M
decisions.context: Prioritization influenced by competitor analysis and internal workshop revealing behavioral gap: users save recipes enthusiastically but rarely act on them

decisions.what: Defer variable pricing to Q3, add to Market Innovation squad backlog
decisions.context: Urgently requested by markets but will define long-term ownership before initiation as pricing ownership is moving to growth MA

action_items.task: Share prioritization framework for Project 5M
Define technical interfaces for decoupling forecasting from personalization
Sign off on Factor requirements integration
Roll out Elysium (new store and homepage in app)
action_items.timeline: Fast rollout with new app features

action_items.task: Roll out menu ranking models prioritizing P500 readiness and Penguin for Factor US
Expand Penguin personalization to INTL markets (HF-UK, HF-CA, CP-CA, HF-ANZ, HF-BNL, HF-DKSE, HF-DEAT)
action_items.timeline: Q1/Q2, other RTE markets in H2

action_items.task: Strengthen RAF program and build new in-product sharing loops
Design better Active Experience and 3rd-party partnerships for Factor
action_items.owner: Alison Ryan with Commercial and New Programs hire

action_items.task: Define long-term ownership for variable pricing

key_points: Clarification of how menu expansion plans, personalization rollouts, and app features integrate together
Elysium rollout followed by new app features including merchandising widgets, recommendation widgets, search functionality, and trending/popular widgets
Menu ranking rollout prioritizes P500 readiness and Penguin for Factor US, with INTL expansion following
Project 5M prioritization framework based on competitor analysis and internal workshop revealing user behavioral gap in recipe execution
Reconciliation of marketing RAF plan with tech yearly plan to address gap between Marketing and Consumer growth targets
Variable pricing is urgently requested feature by markets
Factor tech requests have been collected and integrated into Market Innovation backlog
Loyalty strategy involves maintaining legacy program while implementing new vendor-based program starting in US
blockers: Gap between Marketing and Consumer growth targets for RAF program
Negative results from Programs on Factor funnel requiring pause during peak
Need to define long-term ownership for variable pricing as pricing ownership moves to growth MA
Dependency on technical interface definition for decoupling forecasting from personalization
follow_ups: Walk through detailed methodology for Project 5M prioritization if requested
Assess organizational impact of decoupled forecasting once technical validation complete (Q1-Q2)
Review Factor requirements sign-off with Ed Boyes
Update FAQ 11 regarding RAF program alignment
Further alignment on topics/ordering pending with Tushar, Holger, Fernando, and Leo

entities.context: Owner of Factor tech requests, variable pricing, and Factor programs transition

entities.name: Evan Weintraub
entities.context: Owner of Project 5M, loyalty strategy, and RAF program alignment

entities.name: Lisa Trueblood
entities.context: Preparing Project 5M prioritization one-pager

entities.name: Alison Ryan
entities.context: Partner for Factor programs transition and Active Experience design

entities.name: Adam Park
entities.context: Aligned with Jama and Annie on Factor backlog merge

entities.name: Elysium
entities.context: New store and homepage in the app with fast rollout

entities.name: Project 5M
entities.context: App engagement initiative prioritizing recipe bridge feature based on user behavioral gap

entities.name: Penguin
entities.context: Personalization system for Factor US and INTL markets rollout

entities.name: P500
entities.context: Readiness prioritized in Q4/Q1 for menu ranking rollout

entities.name: RAF (Refer-a-Friend)
entities.context: Program being strengthened by Share squad to address growth target gaps

entities.name: Factor
entities.context: Market with specific tech requirements, programs transition, and Penguin rollout

entities.name: Consumer Mega Alliance
entities.context: Organization creating best digital product experience, subject of 2026 yearly plan

entities.name: Market Innovation squad
entities.context: Squad handling Factor backlog and variable pricing

entities.context: Squad focusing on RAF program and in-product sharing loops

entities.name: Food Systems
entities.context: Team defining technical interfaces for forecasting decoupling and expediting Penguin for INTL

results.doc_title: Notes - The Pets Table - Weekly Check-in
results.meeting_purpose: Weekly check-in for The Pets Table product team to discuss progress, issues, and coordinate on ongoing initiatives
results.date: Dec 17, 2025 (with notes from Dec 10, 2025 and Dec 2, 2025)

decisions.what: Test simpler version of Beam by sharing Transaction Details manually via spreadsheet
decisions.context: Discussion about Beam timing implementation approach

decisions.what: Decide by W52 whether to pause iAdvize experience before Portion Percentage feature launch
decisions.context: iAdvize showing +3% improvement after Nov 20 changes, but needs decision on timing with upcoming feature

decisions.what: Change copy in funnel and active experience from 'meal' to 'recipe'
decisions.context: Terminology standardization across product

action_items.task: Dive deeper into rescheduling including delivery day change
Check with PA on options to shorten the allocation to tests and continuation of iAdvize
Check number and types of questions asked via chatbot once portion % are launched
Start conversation via public squad channel and discuss with Vinicius Fernandes de Jesus
Share with Suzi that all new SKUs should be added to Adjust daily calories
Follow up with PA team regarding reactivation rate reporting
Manage incremental rollout of C@C (Change at Checkout)

key_points: Total Price communication issue with taxes and discounts - discussing options to change tax communication or stop showing total price before discount
Actives dashboard experience scoping document needs alignment with Maria and Prateek
iAdvize error tracking: negative until Nov 20th, +3% after Nov 20 changes with delayed trigger
C@C (Change at Checkout) first test was successful
Reactivation page progress update - fixing multipet issues where voucher not applied for users with active subscriptions
Product PDP potentially launching mid next week
Add-ons dropping from order issue identified
Request to add 'how many pets do you have' funnel data to SFMC for multipet CRM flow
Dashboard simplification and excitement initiative needs scoping and workshop
AAFCO statement finalization for nutritional compliance
blockers: Multipet voucher application issue - voucher not applied because users have active subscription
iAdvize experience timing conflict with Portion Percentage feature launch
Reporting tab no longer supported feature - need to use DWH for conversion data
follow_ups: Continue iAdvize topic offline
Continue discussion about passing multipet data to CRM in the channel
Dashboard simplification and excitement initiative scoping & workshop
Check with global BI on how conversion information is pulled from DWH
Finalize RAF (Refer-a-Friend) values: 100% off trial box (pay shipping only) and TBD credit for referrer

entities.name: The Pets Table (TPT)
entities.context: Main product being discussed, pet food subscription service

entities.name: iAdvize
entities.context: Chatbot/customer service tool showing performance improvements after Nov 20 changes

entities.name: Beam
entities.context: Feature being tested with simplified Transaction Details sharing approach

entities.name: SFMC
entities.context: Salesforce Marketing Cloud - CRM system for customer communications

entities.name: C@C (Change at Checkout)
entities.context: Feature in incremental rollout with successful first test

entities.name: Portion Percentage
entities.context: Upcoming feature launch that may conflict with iAdvize timing

entities.name: Vinicius Fernandes de Jesus
entities.context: Person to discuss request with via squad channel

entities.name: Suzi
entities.context: Person to receive information about new SKUs for Adjust daily calories

entities.name: AAFCO
entities.context: Association of American Feed Control Officials - nutritional standards authority

entities.name: Jira
entities.context: Project management tool referenced for TPT backlog

entities.name: DWH
entities.context: Data warehouse for conversion reporting

entities.name: Gabi and Ryan
entities.context: Working on attribution and tracking setup for multisubscription users

entities.name: Mateusz Borowiak
entities.context: Person Nikita Gorshkov needs to talk to about conversion event modifications

results.doc_title: New Ventures Tribe - Weekly Standup Notes
results.meeting_purpose: Weekly standup for New Ventures Tribe to share team updates, people availability, on-call rotations, and project progress
results.date: 2025-W51 (week of December 16-20, 2025), with notes from W50, W49, and historical 2021-W13

decisions.what: First sprint of 2026 should start Jan 5 for all squads
decisions.context: Sprint alignment across Hellotech organization

decisions.what: Tribe-wide demo at the end of every sprint, recorded and shared
decisions.context: First demo scheduled for Friday, Jan 16, 2026

decisions.what: Q1 2026 on-call rotations split into two: L2 - New Ventures and L2 - Market Innovation
decisions.context: L2 - New Ventures supports client TRE for TPT, GoodChop & VMS brands; L2 - Market Innovation supports backend services until deprecated/handover

decisions.what: Q2+Q3 roadmap priorities established with Porterhouse leading
decisions.context: Hard choices between deliveries will favor higher priority projects

action_items.task: Q1 2026 New Ventures On-Call volunteer sign-up
RSVP for New Ventures Tribe Berlin New Years Dinner
RSVP for New Ventures Toronto Xmas Dinner
Monitor Approved Deployment & No deployment Days during peak
Complete BFF migration in mobile app
Migrate route access control for Delivery Tracking and RaF routes
action_items.timeline: By end of next week (from 2021-W13 context)

action_items.task: Force update mobile app before Alice is killed

key_points: Multiple team members out during weeks 49-51 (holiday period)
Peak release calendar in effect with no deployment days Dec 20 - Jan 18
Sprint alignment across Hellotech starting Jan 5, 2026
On-call rotations established for Q1 2026 with two separate tracks
Social events planned: Anthropic visit Dec 16, Toronto dinner Dec 18, Berlin dinner Jan 27
BFF migration nearing completion in mobile app
Additional Vouchers support being implemented for web and mobile
Alice API being deprecated and removed
blockers: Peak deployment restrictions from Dec 20 - Jan 18 limiting releases
Multiple team members out during holiday period affecting capacity
follow_ups: Review Q2+Q3 roadmap priorities if concerns arise about high-priority projects
Cleanup work needed on web and mobile after BFF migration
Complete deprecation/handover of backend services previously owned by TAM

decisions.what: First sprint of 2026 should start Jan 5 for all squads

decisions.context: L2 - New Ventures supports client TRE for TPT, GoodChop & VMS brands; L2 - Market Innovation supports backend services until deprecated/handover
